sentences.sContent: The mother is usually awarded custody (= legally allowed to have custody ) .
sentences.sCn: 母亲通常会获得监护权。

sentences.sContent: a dispute over who should have custody of the children
sentences.sCn: 关于孩子监护权归属问题的争执

sentences.sContent: The couple will retain joint custody (= they will both have custody ) of their daughters.
sentences.sCn: 夫妇俩将继续保留对女儿的共同监护权。

sentences.sContent: Allen is fighting a bitter custody battle over his three children.
sentences.sCn: 艾伦为获得自己三个孩子的监护权拼死力争。

trans.tranOther: the right to take care of a child, given to one of their parents when they have  divorced
